source.386242c3:
str_list = [] # empty list to contain columns with strings
for colname, colvalue in train.iteritems():
    if type(colvalue[1]) == str:
        str_list.append(colname)
#Get to the numeric columns by inversion
num_list = train.columns.difference(str_list)
print(str_list)
print(num_list)
source.7a000720:
from sklearn.preprocessing import OneHotEncoder
onehot_encoder = OneHotEncoder()
raw_data_cat_onehot_Embarked = onehot_encoder.fit_transform(train[["Embarked"]])
print(raw_data_cat_onehot_Embarked.toarray()[:10])
print(onehot_encoder.categories_)
